Class Mobile

  • java.lang.Object
    • gremlins.Entity
      • gremlins.Mobile
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Gremlin, Projectile, Wizard

    public abstract class Mobile
extends Entity
    Abstract Mobile class of objects

      Attribute used for specific mobile entities that have a certain timeframe they must act upon

    • Constructor Detail

      • Mobile

        public Mobile(int x,
              int y,
              int speed,
              int xVel,
              int yVel)
        Constructor for mobile
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate
        speed - size of the steps the mobile entities make per tick
        xVel - rate of change of x position
        yVel - rate of change of y posiiton

    • Method Detail

      • getAlive

        public boolean getAlive()
        getter method for whether the mobile should be displayed on screen or considered for collisions
        Returns:
        boolean whether the mobile is alive or not

      • setAlive

        public void setAlive(boolean b)
        setter method for whether the mobile should be displayed on screen or considered for collisions
        Parameters:
        b - boolean whether the mobile is alive or not

      • getSpeed

        public int getSpeed()
        getter method for getting each mobile entity's base speed
        Returns:
        speed integer that corresponds to the number of pixels each entity moves per tick.

      • getDirection

        public int getDirection()
        getter method for the direction the mobile is facing.
        Returns:
        integer that corresponds with the direction the mobile is facing (0, up; 1, right; 2 down; 3, left)

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(int dir)
        setter method for the direction the mobile is facing
        Parameters:
        dir - integer that corresponds with the direction the mobile is facing (0, up; 1, right; 2 down; 3, left)

      • getXVel

        public int getXVel()
        getter method for the mobile's x velocity
        Returns:
        integer that corresponds to +/- mobile speed

      • getYVel

        public int getYVel()
        getter method for the mobile's y velocity
        Returns:
        integer that correspods to +/- mobile speed

      • getSideAV

        public boolean[] getSideAV()
        getter method for the side availability.
        Returns:
        an array of booleans that corresponds with which sides are available [up, right, down, left].
